title: Random floating-point errors in GitHub Actions

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

labels.name: ci
labels.description: Relating to Continuous Integration / GitHub Actions

body:
Copied from https://github.com/dsgibbons/shap/issues/98

We have seen GitHub Actions randomly fail occasionally due to floating-point precision issues. See, for example:

- https://github.com/dsgibbons/shap/actions/runs/5085485586/attempts/1 (EDIT: py3.8, `tests/explainers/test_deep.py::test_pytorch_mnist_cnn`)
- https://github.com/dsgibbons/shap/actions/runs/5135384415/attempts/1 (EDIT: py3.11, `tests/explainers/test_deep.py::test_pytorch_single_output`)

In both cases, the tests passed after being re-run with no source code changes. We should consider either increasing some of the floating-point tolerances, or investigate why we are seeing such large random deviations in `test_deep.py`.

## List of flaky tests

Here's a list of all the flaky tests we know of so far (feel free to edit). 

- [ ] `test_tf_keras_linear` with seed `256`
- [ ] `test_single_tree_compare_with_kernel_shap` with seed `434`
- [ ] `test_single_tree_nonlinear_transformations` with seed `116`
- [ ] `test_xgboost_classifier_independent_margin` with seed `364`
- [ ] `test_gradient.py::test_pytorch_mnist_cnn` with seed `24`
- [ ] `test_deep.py::test_pytorch_mnist_cnn` with seed `212`
- [ ] `test_pytorch_single_output`
- [ ] `test_xgboost_direct` with seed `28`
- [ ] `test_several_trees` with seed `411`
- [ ] `test_shape_values_linear_many_features` with seed `94` (**this test seems particular egregious, it's failing 59 out of the first 100 seeds**)
